item.title: Welcome!
item.description: Introducing the Line of Trust (LOTr) Erasing the line of death for fun and pleasure Motivation The Line of Death (LoD) is a class of web browser attacks that target the very pixels of a browser UI on a given webpage, especially with regards to the (presumably) browser-controlled portion of the UI above webpage content. The Line of Death. Image credit LoD attacks span the spectrum from manipulating URL names and tabs to spoofing new browser windows within the webpage’s content area:

body { background-color: #ffffff; font-family: 'Cardo', serif; } h3 { color: #000000; margin-left: 0px; font-family: 'Raleway', serif; } a { text-decoration: none; color: #0000aa; } a:hover { text-decoration: none; color:#ff0000; } William T. Young William T. Young Ensign, US Navy Graduate Fellow Department of Computer Science School of Engineering and Applied Science University of Virginia Charlottesville, VA 22904, USA bill@williamtyoung.com www.williamtyoung.com Resume | Vitae | GitHub Albums - Life | Career | USNA Useful stuff you might like A Brief Summary Education & Academics I am a newly commissioned officer in the US Navy, currently pursuing a master's degree in computer science at the University of Virginia.
